intro: Rinorea leucoclada, commonly known as the white-flowered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Rinorea leucoclada is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and delicate appearance.
